title: 06. Augustus and the Imperial Cult
description: Augustus’ careful management of ruler worship and the development of the imperial cult across the Roman world.

questions.question: Why could Augustus not allow worship of himself in the West in the Eastern model?
options: Roman traditions opposed worship of living individuals

questions.question: What form of imperial cult developed in the western provinces after 12 BCE?
options: The cult of Rome and Augustus

questions.question: Who participated in the worship of ‘Rome and Augustus’ in the West?
Which figures were worshipped by Roman citizens instead of Augustus himself?
What belief allowed Romans to honour Augustus without calling him a god?
options: The concept of numen and genius

questions.question: What aspect of Augustus was permitted to be worshipped by Roman citizens?
What evidence supports the worship of Augustus’ numen in the West?
options: The altar at Narbo in Gaul

questions.question: How does Ovid describe the worship of Augustus’ genius?
options: At crossroads associated with the Lares

questions.question: How did Egyptians initially respond to Augustus’ rule?
options: They petitioned to worship him as a living god

questions.question: Why did Augustus view worship of a living ruler as dangerous?
Where was a temple to Octavian reported in the East?
Which author mentions a temple to Octavian at Pergamum?
What compromise did Augustus adopt regarding imperial worship in the East?
Why was a universal imperial cult attractive to Augustus?
How did Augustus balance eastern ruler worship with Roman tradition?
